msContents.summary: Inner text of duplicate receipt for croton handed by Phanesis, administrator acting for Zenon; the Greek text is followed by a few lines in Demotic

msItem.note: Written across the fibers with 10 lines; the back is blank
Plate in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XX tavola IX
Pap.Lugd.Bat. XX 12, reedition of two fragments, Col.inv. 224 and Cairo JdE 53781

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman and New York dealer J. Brummer, through H.I. Bell, November 1925; no. 21 (original no. 16) in Bell's inventory

keywords.term: Many names, -- see Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p. 274-457

div.ab: Year 32, Epeiph 22. Korragos, assistant of Hermolaos, and Chaiophis, assistant of Horos, the royal secretary, acknowledges receipt from Phanesis, grain measurer, agent of Zenon, of 100 2/3 artabs by the 29 choinix measure of uncleaned croton from the Arsinoite nome, a sample of which the grain measurer has placed under seal in a container.

listBibl.bibl: P.Col. III 40 P.Col.Zen. I 40 P.Cair.Zen. IV 59670
